title.rendered: Rooms for Rent in Financial District, NYC

content.rendered:
Before choosing rooms for rent in Financial District, NYC, check this neighborhood guide. We’ll cover the average rent in Financial District, as well as the area’s safety levels and public transit options. We’ll also highlight a few of the must-visit museums and the best places to eat in the area.

NYC is one of the most photographed cities in the world! Along with its many attractions, it’s also one of the world’s leading financial centers. So, expect a busy week-life and relaxed weekends. New to the city? Take the subway to one of the many restaurants in the Financial District, to get a taste of your new neighborhood.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In New York City

Where is Financial District?

Financial District is also known as FiDi, Lower Manhattan, and Downtown NY. Situated at the southern tip of Manhattan Island in New York City, it’s bound by South Ferry and the Battery to the south. You’ll find West Side Highway to the west, Chambers Street, and City Hall Park to the north. There’s also Brooklyn Bridge on the northeast side and the East River to the southeast.

When looking for rooms for rent in Financial District, it’s worth considering how close these locations are. From here, you can also easily access both the east and the west side of Manhattan. You can even enjoy dinner with a view at one of the local waterfront restaurants.

Related: Find Rooms for Rent in Manhattan, NY

Find Rooms for Rent in Financial District

Find Rooms For Rent In Financial District

The hunt to find rooms for rent in Financial District can be exciting and overwhelming. Mainly due to the various options available to you. Choose from townhouses, high-rise buildings or even apartments with landscaped rooftop terraces. You’ll also find lofts fitted with up-to-date amenities in this neighborhood.

If luxury condos are more your thing, take a look at rentals with waterfront views. Some even have doorman services, fitness centers and resident media centers. All in all, the variety doesn’t make the choice easy. And, while NYC has lots of entertainment options, try not to miss the parks, museums and restaurants in Financial District. These will help you choose the best place to put down roots.

Related: Living in NYC: Affordable Neighborhoods In Manhattan

Average Rent in Financial District

Know your personal preferences and commit to them when looking for rooms in Financial District. The average rent in Financial District certainly isn’t cheap, but it can offer value for money. Despite the high prices, most renters are young working professionals. Sharing with roommates is therefore one way to get the most out of living in the area without breaking the bank.

Here are some average rent costs in the area to consider when looking for rooms for rent in Financial District:

Nearby Neighborhoods: Battery Park City, Tribeca, Chinatown, and the Lower East Side.

Related: How To Find Cheap Apartments in New York? Manhattan Edition!

Is Financial District safe?

FiDi falls under NYPD’s 1st Precinct and is one of the safest places in NYC. Having said that, we’d suggest you don’t venture out alone at night unless you have to. Also, previously FiDi did not have much nightlife, but things are changing. Today, you’ll find people out and about in the evening enjoying themselves. However, everywhere can be unsafe at times. For peace of mind, carry mace and keep emergency numbers handy. Here are some helpful numbers you can use if you ever need them.

NYPD important numbers:

  • Emergency: 911
  • Non-Emergency: 311
  • NYPD General Inquiries: 646-610-5000

Related: Fun Things To Do In Manhattan In A Single Weekend!

Public Transit in Financial District

Financial District, NYC has an extensive public transportation system. And, as a first-time visitor, navigating through it all can be complicated. To help you out, we’ve listed some useful information on public transit below. Read on to find out how best to get around when you’re new to the area.

1. Walkability

With a walk score of 100, you’re sure to enjoy the first few weeks in FiDi exploring the area on foot. You can accomplish most daily errands this way – just try and keep your eyes on the path!

2. Roads & Traffic

For the most part, roads around Financial District are busy and congested. Traffic is heaviest at rush hour and parking can be difficult. Planning ahead will help, so we’ve included a parking app site for you to use if needed.

Park Whiz Website

3. Nearby Train Stations Financial District

  • IRT Broadway–Seventh Avenue Line: Lines 1, 2, and 3.
  • Wall Street Station: Lines 2 and 3.
  • Stations to nearby neighborhoods:
  • East to West – East River to West St.
  • North to South – Frankfort St. to State St.

4. Nearby Bus Stops

The M15, M20, M55, M103, and SBS routes run north-south through the area, and the M9 and M22 routes run west-east in the area. Below is a detailed map for bus routes and a transit app to simplify the public transit system for you. We’ve also included a link to useful hacks for the NYC subways system to make things easier.

MTA Map
Moovit App

5. Ferry

Affordable ferry rides are also available from and to Brooklyn – that’s how it all began after all! Visit the website or download the app to learn more.

Website

Related: Hacks to the NYC subways

Restaurants in Financial District

While you search for rooms for rent in Financial District or after you’ve finished, you need to try the local cuisine. There are a number of restaurants in Financial District to choose from, and below we’ve noted a few of the best for you to try.

1. Shake Shack

Recently opened in Fulton Transit Center on Broadway Street, is Shake Shack. At this affordable, classic fast-food joint, you’ll find an array of burgers, hotdogs, beer, shakes, and more.

Order Now!
Website

2. Nish Nush

Here is another place to visit after a tiring day looking for rooms for rent in Financial District. Enjoy healthy vegetarian dishes at Nish Nush and contemplate whether the average rent in Financial District is right for you. This Israeli-inspired restaurant also offers gluten-free and vegan options.

Website
Order Now!

Trinity Place

When it comes to choosing restaurants in Financial District, we just had to include fine dining. So, here it is, in the bank vault no less! Before you make a reservation, take a look at their delicious food and drinks menu using the link below.

Website

Related: 5 Manhattan Restaurants and 5 Delivery Apps to Try

Parks in Financial District

Parks are important areas in any town, but even more so in urban jungles. After exploring rooms for rent in Financial District, why not take a stroll in the park? It’ll help you relax and get to know the city better. Below are some of our favorite parks in the neighborhood.

  • Liberty Park in Manhattan is an elevated public park at the World Trade Center. Here, you will also find the exemplary restored sculptures from the WTC site.
  • Bowling Green is a small, historical public park in FiDi. It’s actually the oldest in the area! From here, you can view the many famous historic buildings of New York City.
  • Pier 26 Hudson River Park is located in Tribeca in Lower Manhattan. Here you can enjoy outrigger rowing and kayaking, along with other water activities like fishing and boat building.

Related: Zoos You Can Visit in NYC

Museums in Financial District

Want to understand FiDi and its lifestyle better? Get to know more about the area’s history and cultural background by visiting some of the top museums in Financial District.

  • The Skyscraper Museum: you don’t want to miss this! This museum in Financial District will teach you all about the region’s tallest skyscrapers.
  • The New York City Police Museum: another aspect of NYC that is famous the world over, is the NYPD. Since 1845 it’s been an integral part of this city’s growth and you can learn about it here.
  • Museum of American Finance: the clue’s in the name. When in FiDi, we highly recommend you visit this unique museum.
  • Museum of Jewish Heritage: With artifacts and collections spanning several centuries, the turbulent history of the Jewish people is illustrated with audio and videos.

Related: Things To Do In Manhattan, NY With Your Roommates!

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Financial District? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
